{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":2966094,"name":"Debbie Bernier","username":"crazycats","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/4af34b/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-08-22T18:16:37.431Z","cooked":"

Newbie to the Romi here. Just started the process of getting it imaged. All went well until this step:
https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/romi-robot/imaging-romi.html#u4-control-board
It says to click “update firmware” however it’s grayed out.
I connected from the Pi to the Romi using the micro USB cable which came in the Romi kit. I am connected to the Romi wifi, the system status page looks fine. I’ve tried clicking the writeable button which makes all the buttons on the Romi page go active (except update firmware).

What am I doing wrong?
And while I’m here, could someone explain why there is a power switch as well as a power button on the Romi? What’s the difference?

Thanks

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":6,"updated_at":"2021-08-22T18:16:37.431Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":539,"reads":167,"readers_count":166,"score":2743.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":395684,"topic_slug":"update-firmware-grayed-out","display_username":"Debbie Bernier","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://docs.wpilib.org/en/stable/docs/romi-robot/imaging-romi.html#u4-control-board","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Imaging your Romi — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation","clicks":14}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26700,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/update-firmware-grayed-out/395684/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":2966116,"name":null,"username":"veg","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/3be4f8/{size}.png","created_at":"2021-08-22T21:46:57.025Z","cooked":"

I would check your USB cable to make sure it is firmly connected. Or maybe try another cable if you have one handy. I forget offhand if you need to be “writable” to do a firmware update, but it can’t hurt. Do you get any LED activity on the Romi controller when you plug the USB cable in?

The slide switch and the pushbutton power switch are somewhat redundant. But in my experience the slide switches are susceptible to having the tab sheared off, and to a lesser extent the pushbuttons also can be damaged without too much effort. I usually leave the slide switch “off” and use the pushbutton to toggle power on and off, but you can use either switch. There are contacts on the Romi board to connect external power switches, if desired.

There’s a ton of great information in the user’s guide for the controller board.

Thanks! Pilot error in connecting the cable. I got it working. Thanks for the link to the user’s guide. That’s very helpful.

I’m having the same problem with the “update firmware” button grayed out. I am in writeable mode and all other buttons are selectable. I have checked the usb cable and plugged it into several of the rPi usb slots. All result in a lit green led next the usb slot on the 32u4 board, but update button is always gray.

Have tried re-flashing sd card and resetting the romi. Any suggestions?

Thanks!

We have been noticing that many USB cables do not have strong data connections (we tried 4 before we found one our PS4controller can use reliably). I would also check that. Use a cable that you know has an effective data connection.
